intro: Sphaerostephanos decadens, commonly known as the rare desert starflower, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its unique, star-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and orange. The plant has small, succulent leaves adapted to conserve water in its harsh environment. Its flowering period typically occurs during the rainy season, and it relies on specific pollinators for reproduction. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its natural range.
